Talk:Requirements for Tal'Anee Beta

From Peragro Tempus Wiki

What has to be done

While talking about goal, it's probably worth mentioning what has to be done to call it a beta, as opposed to simply what we'd like to have done. This probably wouldn't represent the full set of goals for a release, and most (but not all) of it is already part of the game.

PT intends to be an RP game, and thus, first and foremost, the systems supporting RP need to be solid and in place. In particular, the game is a chatroom in a graphical environment. So, first, it needs to have full chat support. And it needs to be in a graphical environment. Which means that you'd have an avatar in a (in this case 3D) world, who can move around, and look around. The choice of character shouldn't restrict the role for the player. This means, first, that both male and female choices should be possible. And second, a male without the armor should be an option.

In the 3D world, there should be at least something there. Buildings, town, whatever, so that there's something to see, and not just a simple 3D demo terrain. And characters in the world. Along the same lines, there should be a hint of context, enough so that it's clear that it's a fantasy setting.

The world should be interactive. This means that, at the least, one should be able to recognize, examine, and where possible, use and pickup/drop items. Some form of inventory management, and the ability to wear/equip items shouldn't be too much to expect, nor would exchanging items with NPCs. It should be possible to talk to NPCs.

There should be something to do. That means that from the beginning, the character should be clear about where he is and what's going on, and that there's at least one form of activity (i.e. combat) that one can take part in right away, and presumably indefinitely.

--Eklina 03:39, 18 January 2009 (UTC)

This list is, in essence, what I've been pushing towards. I list more detailed requirements (the ability for NPCs to react to non- "talk to me" stimuli rather than "interactivity", for example) to help illustrate the items that need developed to "complete" (or make usable) that aspect of the goal. it is worth noting that some items can be placeheld- for example, I've seriously considered using some simple geometric shapes for NPCs while we wait for character art. Darker Dreams 17:43, 18 January 2009 (UTC)
